title: "The Symbolism of Dante's Divine Comedy and the Journey through the Planets and Stars"
first_phrase: In the previous text, the symbolism of Delos Island from Greek mythology was discussed and its parallels with Dante's work. Delos represents the meeting point between different elements and the beginning of the rebis formation, a crucial phase in alchemy. In Dante's work, the Purgatory represents the stage of overcoming individual compulsions, leading to the meeting between happiness and the feminine aspect of self. This phase is followed by the ascent to seven heavens, representing the stage of exaltation. The last 200 tokens explore the depiction of Paradise in Dante's work, divided into nine ethereal and immaterial heavens. These heavens are named after the planets of the solar system, with the last two consisting of the sphere of fixed stars and the First Mover.
content: Abbiamo quindi dapprima il Purgatorio con sette cornici (equivalenti terreni dei pianeti) e con ciò lo scioglimento delle “compulsioni” che ci allontanano dal centro e ci impediscono di riunificarci ed essere veramente uomini. Superate le compulsioni, si è cima al monte del Purgatorio, nel paradiso terrestre, ovverosia il massimo stato raggiungibile senza elevazione energetica. Successivamente Dante potrà salire ancora attraverso i sette cieli (l’espressione “essere al settimo cielo” viene proprio da questa antica tradizione). E’ la fase dell’”esaltazione”. Nella “Divina Commedia” il Paradiso appare allora come un mondo immateriale, etereo, diviso in nove cieli: i primi sette prendono il nome dai pianeti del sistema solare (nell'ordine Luna, Mercurio, Venere, Sole, Marte, Giove, Saturno), gli ultimi due sono costituiti dalla sfera delle stelle fisse e dal Primo mobile.
last_phrase: In conclusion, Dante's journey through the Purgatorio and Paradiso serves as a reminder that we must shed our earthly compulsions to reach a higher state of consciousness. Through his ascent through the planets and the nine celestial spheres, Dante symbolizes the expansion of the spirit and the ultimate goal of becoming one with God. The path to this enlightenment lies within us and can be achieved through careful attention to the correspondence between our bodies and the various levels of consciousness.
